intro: Quamoclit bona-nox, commonly known as the night-bloom beauty, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking, large, and fragrant flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant has dark green, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are typically pale purple to white, with a strong, sweet scent. Quamoclit bona-nox thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
